intro: Caballeroa, commonly known as the desert globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its distinctive globular shape and vibrant yellow or orange flowers. The plant has thick, fleshy stems and leaves that are adapted to store water, allowing it to thrive in arid environments. Caballeroa is part of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. Its flowers bloom in the spring and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
